intro: Oxydectes hypoleuca, commonly known as the white-flowered oxydectes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting well to poor soil conditions. Oxydectes hypoleuca is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
